intro: Humboltia diptera, commonly known as the desert holly, is a shrub native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry conditions. Its leaves are thick and waxy, reducing water loss and enabling it to thrive in low-water environments. Humboltia diptera plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
